definition: to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: I glimpsed the dancer balancing herself on the ambulance by become.
sentences.chinese: 我掽巧瞥見舞蹈者在捄護車上使自己保持平衡。

sentences.english: It gives you a little idea of the character of Socrates.
sentences.chinese: 這讓我們瞥見蘇格拉底個性的一面。

sentences.english: Suddenly, I caught sight of the Valentine flowers which was a bouquet of roses and carnations given by my husband.
sentences.chinese: 我從眼角瞥見了那由玫瑰和康乃馨組成的情人節花束。

sentences.english: Learn about glimpsing a Card in this free magic lesson video.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解有關瞥見在這個自由魔法課的視頻卡。

sentences.english: I glimpsed the dancer balancing herself on the ambulance by chance.
sentences.chinese: 我可巧瞥見跳舞者在救護車上使本身保存均衡。

sentences.english: The man glanced the burglar climbing out of the window.
sentences.chinese: 那人瞥見小偷爬出窗戶。

sentences.english: Through the key-hole, the policeman caught glimpses of a body lying on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 透過銷眼，警察瞥見房間內躺着一具屍體。

sentences.english: From the throngs of crowds, she espied a young man.
sentences.chinese: 在萬頭攢動的人羣中，瞥見一名年輕男子。

sentences.english: Archaeologists around the world are waiting for a glimpse of this newly-discovered civilization's artifacts.
sentences.chinese: 考古學家在世界各地都等待瞥見這個發現文明的文物。

sentences.english: Learn about glimpsing a Card in a Shuffle in this free magic lesson video.
sentences.chinese: 在詳細瞭解瞥見在這個自由洗牌魔術課的視頻卡。

sentences.english: The other car didn't see me, Mom.
sentences.chinese: 另外一輛車出瞥見我，媽媽。

sentences.english: He glimpsed a gun protruding from the man's pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他瞥見這個人的口袋裏伸出來一支槍。

sentences.english: Mankind has begun to glimpse its illimitable powers.
sentences.chinese: 人類終於得以瞥見一絲無窮的能量。

sentences.english: Babies catching the first glimpse of this exciting world.
sentences.chinese: 仔魚第一次瞥見這個令人興奮的世界。

sentences.english: You just didn't see it because the wrong one was blocking the sight.
sentences.chinese: 只是那些錯的人蓋住了你的視野，你纔沒有瞥見。

sentences.english: FADE IN: WE ARE FLYING through mist, a dimly glimpsed forest below.
sentences.chinese: 淡入:我們正飛越薄霧，下面朦朧可以瞥見森林。

definition: to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
divine light (around the Buddha)/a halo/a miraculous column of light/(slang) jolly good!
bored to death (idiom)/bored stiff/overcome with boredom
